Add support for center non-repeated section in nine patches
data.body:
![button_divide_redside_right 9](https://f.cloud.github.com/assets/1621682/1502128/7b863e7e-4896-11e3-8c06-b4dde84eb207.png)

On Android, this is a valid nine-patch where the center section is not repeated. It can be checked using the Android draw9patch tool included with the Android SDK.

Libgdx seems to assume that there are only four non-repeated regions in a nine-patch, so that this image is drawn with the center non-repeated section off to one side, instead of in the center.

I'd definitely be open to a workaround, if there is one available.

data.title: Error on texture update - Number of remaining buffer elements is 589824, must be at least 589824
data.body:
When updating the contents of a Texture, I get the following exception. Notice the "Number of remaining buffer elements is 589824, must be at least 589824" part. 

The check buffer size method checks "buf.remaining() < size". I think <= should be enough... Or the error message should be updated ;)

Exception in thread "LWJGL Application" java.lang.IllegalArgumentException: Number of remaining buffer elements is 589824, must be at least 589824. Because at most 589824 elements can be returned, a buffer with at least 589824 elements is required, regardless of actual returned element count
    at org.lwjgl.BufferChecks.throwBufferSizeException(BufferChecks.java:162)
    at org.lwjgl.BufferChecks.checkBufferSize(BufferChecks.java:189)
    at org.lwjgl.BufferChecks.checkBuffer(BufferChecks.java:230)
    at org.lwjgl.opengl.GL11.glTexSubImage2D(GL11.java:2949)
    at com.badlogic.gdx.backends.lwjgl.LwjglGL20.glTexSubImage2D(LwjglGL20.java:574)
    at com.badlogic.gdx.graphics.Texture.draw(Texture.java:171)

data.title: AllHitsRayResultCallback not fully implemented
data.body:
The methods of this callback are not implemented yet, to get the results.

AllHitsRayResultCallback#getCollisionObjects()
AllHitsRayResultCallback#getHitFractions()
AllHitsRayResultCallback#getHitNormalWorld()
AllHitsRayResultCallback#getHitPointWorld()

Would be nice to get all the hits of a RayTest in some situations.

data.title: Add derivative calculations to CatmullRomSpline
data.body: I added the calculation of the derivative of the spline. This finds the tangent of the curve at the desired point.

data.title: Added a simply system to keep record of the x most recently played
data.body:
OpenALSoundS (where x is the number of simulataneous sources allowed) and,
in case a new sound refuses to play, stop()'s the least recently played
sound and attempts to play it again (but only once, to prevent endless
loops in case something else prevents the sound from playing).

data.title: "GdxRuntimeException: Unabe (sic) to allocate audio buffers" after reloading music from AssetManager
Update custom mouse cursor image support.
data.body:
The Windows operating system has the additional requirement for a custom
mouse cursor image to have a width and height that are both
powers-of-two greater than zero (not necessarily equal).

Update the documentation of the setCursorImage method in the Gdx.Input
interface to add this requirement.

Update the setCursorImage method to throw a GdxRuntimeException if the
width or height are not both powers-of-two greater than zero.

Improve exception messages that occur when a hotspot param passed to
Gdx.Input.setCursorImage is outside the bounds of the image represented
by the pixmap param.

data.title: Bullet, small changes
data.body:
- Use long instead of void \* 
- Pool btBroadPhaseProxy and btBroadPhasePair
- Implement some arrays, rename btManifoldArray

data.title: Feature: deactivate continous rendering even though input events are being registered.
data.body:
I'm using the version currently available on Maven (0.9.9-SNAPSHOT). As per the tutorial I've implemented an input processor that allows me to turn on and off continous rendering. I can turn off continous rendering, but the wiki says that input events will still trigger the render thread. This makes it very hard to implement a debugging functionality. I want to specifically request each time the rendering should run to debug coordinates and the like.

Is there a possibility that we could see this feature in a new version?
